title: Unity Township, Columbiana County, Ohio
data: Unity Township is one of the eighteen townships of Columbiana County, Ohio, United States. The 2020 census reported 9,721 people living in the township. Located in the northeastern corner of the county, it borders the following townships: One city and two villages are located in Unity Township: It is the only Unity Township statewide.[4] The township was organized in 1806 and named by George Augustine.[5] The township is governed by a three-member board of trustees, who are elected in November of odd-numbered years to a four-year term beginning on the following January 1. Two are elected in the year after the presidential election and one is elected in the year before it. There is also an elected township fiscal officer,[6] who serves a four-year term beginning on April 1 of the year after the election, which is held in November of the year before the presidential election. Vacancies in the fiscal officership or on the board of trustees are filled by the remaining trustees.
